paper_abstract: In this paper we present a simple method for minimal distortion development of triangulated surfaces for mapping and imaging. The method is based on classical results of F. Gehring and Y. Vaisala regarding the existence of quasi-conformal and quasi-isometric mappings between Riemannian manifolds. A random starting triangle version of the algorithm is presented. A curvature based version is also applicable. In addition the algorithm enables the user to compute the maximal distortion errors. Moreover, the algorithm makes no use to derivatives, hence it is suitable for analysis of noisy data. The algorithm is tested on data obtained from real CT images of the human brain cortex.
paper_title: Quasi-isometric and quasi-conformal development of triangulated surfaces for computerized tomography
